metadata.title: CVE-2015-5311 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
PowerDNS (aka pdns) Authoritative Server 3.4.4 before 3.4.7 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and server crash)via crafted query packets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5311` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-geoip - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-lua - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-mydns - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-remote - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 3.4.7-1
pdns-server - 3.4.7-1
pdns-tools - 3.4.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.7-1').
